data.title: Filling lunch specials under $10
data.text: I usually order the Empress lo mein which is terrific, but I decided to try the shrimp with hot garlic sauce. It was spicy, but not overbearing. My husband's beef and broccoli was very good as well. I don't think we have ever completely finished a meal here; there's always plenty to take home.

data.title: Good food
data.text:
I had a craving for fried rice. I ended up eating a chicken plate. Good food, good price. 
I think it is a new or just getting off the ground restaurant. Don't let that fool ya.

data.title: Great authentic Chinese food
data.text: Tried this place as our favorite Fongs was under remodel. I must say this place is grant for different reasons. Incredible egg rolls and the best fried won ton ever. I had the mandarin chicken, perfect and ice had sweet n sour with no complaints. Great portions on lunch menu. Look forward to a return visit soon.

data.title: Decent Chinese
data.text: Good place for a combo platter.  Nice decor. The General Tso is pretty good, as is the service level.

data.title: They're no House of Lee, but pretty darn close
data.text:
Service is a little confusing, but someone is always checking up on you periodically.

A more descriptive menu would be of benefit, however the servers I've had seem knowledgable of the dishes in question and are able to explain them well enough.

The egg rolls are fantastic and the hot and sour soup is great, as for today I tried the Ants Up a Tree dish that was supposed to be spicy and was a tad disappointed. Don't get me wrong, the dish was good but I was expecting spicy and what I got was rather bland. Perhaps I can request for more levels of hot on my next visit, we shall see.

With that last thought in mind, I'm thinking to ask them if they can do a House of Lee style #46 Bok Choy with Pork. 

Overall, this is a very good place that gives you a lot of eats for a reasonable cost.

data.title: Always a good meal
data.text:
My wife & I go here very often... the lunch specials are very good.
A lo0t of food at a very reasonable price (about $10) We have never left here without a "go box" the food quality is exceptional

data.title: Quick Lunch
data.text: We had time to kill before our flight home and this place came up on the GPS.  We were a little hesitant at first but decided to give it a try.  This place is much larger inside than it appears from the street. We found the staff generally friendly, the food average at best. My wife's Lemon Chicken was bountiful and pretty good. My Garlic Shrimp left a bit to be desired. The vegetables were overcooked/ the steamed rice mushy. I thought the lunch pricing a bit high but that may be the area. I will look elsewhere in the future.

data.title: Lots of great food for a very reasonable price!  Plenty leftovers...
data.text:
We have been coming to this restaurant for years and have always been very satisfied with the quality and quantity of the food.  This is the place to go if you are really hungry and have only about $10 for lunch for $13 for dinner.  
Every dish we have eaten here has been very good, and we have tried most of the menu.

data.title: Great food and plenty to eat
data.text: Youngs has been a long time favorite it ours.  The food is very good and the speed of getting the food to the table is super fast.  The appetizers are also very good.

data.title: Old but good
data.text:
Young's Garden has been here forever, and it looks it.  I stopped for lunch yesterday and my initial reaction was "why am I here?"  I stood at the door for several minutes and was not approached by a host/hostess.  I asked at the bar and was told "any table."  The staff I came in contact with were not fluent in English.  When I finally got a menu, I was really disappointed because it seemed very sparse.  I selected Sweet & Sour Chicken which was served with fried rice and an egg roll.  As I waited for my lunch, I had a chance to examine the facility, and it was OLD.  I couldn't tell if the carpet had a pattern until a found a spot that apparently had something standing on for a while.  A colorful pattern was obvious, but dirt and grime hid it everywhere else.  

However, the food was actually pretty good and was delivered hot.  My portion was ample, and I did not leave hungry.  The customers that were there, appeared to be business folks from the area.  I asked for and received a full menu, which looked to be complete and varied, but a little on the pricey side.  

I will return, but maybe for dinner to get a better idea of the capabilities of this place.

data.title: Lost a LONGTIME customer :(
data.text: They close on Saturdays at 10:30P.M. We arrived around 9:30P.M. The good thing was that they sat us immediately as it was not busy at all. Only 1 other table besides our party of 7. The food came out quickly and it was hot, another plus for them.Now that's the only good I can say. Our server clearly did NOT want to be there. She and 3 other woman who worked  there were standing nearby and speaking loudly in Chinese, even talking over us. We could not enjoy much conversation because of them, but I would have been willing to overlook this, had the other part of the service been okay. My 17 year old son asked for ketchup and my husband also asked for it and it was not brought to us. I sent my son up to the counter to ask once again and he finally got it. When the to-go boxes and the bill came, I had to answer my cell phone. It was 10:05 at this point, still not quite closing-time. I understand that employees want to get out on time and go home, but what happened next is BEYOND RUDE and INEXCUSABLE. The server started packing up my children's food and when she came to me, she interrupted my phone conversation and asked if I was finished. I put my hand up to indicate that I would be with her soon because I wanted to pack my OWN food. She rudely ripped open a to-go box and started packing my food. She also took my son's food and dumped it into the box that had my food! Then, she grabbed my eggroll with her BARE HANDS and shoved it into the box. I was in shock and disbelief. I told my husband that I felt rushed and rudely treated and he told me that she put my son's sesame chicken in with her bare hands too. I paid and we left. I called and asked for  management and the woman who had served me told me to come back and she will give me another eggroll. Really? She then told me she was sorry and not to be upset because her hands were clean! This is completely UNSANITARY! My husband manages a grocery store and had this happened, disciplinary action would be taken. I tried to explain this concept to the woman, but she kept insisting her hands were clean and telling me to come get another eggroll and that she would give me 5 more pieces of sesame chicken. We will NEVER go back and we have been customers since 1995! I am going to follow this up with the board of health because if this happened in front of us, I hate to see what they do with the food in the back where we cannot see them. :(

data.title: Very Inconsistent
data.text: This place when it's good... it's very good. When it's bad, its not mentionable. Been coming here since they went into business and I personally know the owner and been in the kitchen. The egg rolls and fried rice when done right is very good. The Chinese dishes I have tried all of them. The weakness here is that it depends on who's in the kitchen cooking. The sauces can be very week on certain dishes like the Young's Garden Subgum, rendering it flavorless. I personally like the steamed dumplings which are pretty consistent along with the shrimp toast. The Moo Shoo Pork is very good as well as the Kung Pao Chicken Ding, crab and corn soup, pepper steak and Lomi Lomi. Other dished are good as well but not too consistent as mentioned as server her can be a big issue and confusing.
